intro: Leptogramma xingwenensis, commonly known as the Xingwen leptogramma, is a rare fern species native to China. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores for propagation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research.
